intro: Ichnanthus villosus, commonly known as the hairy twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, hairy foliage. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The plant has slender, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in a spike, and are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Ichnanthus villosus plays a role in supporting local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar resources for pollinators.
